DateTimeZone.getOffsetFromLocal [2952991] The behaviour during DST overlaps is now defined to always return the earlier instant which is normally known as daylight or summer time. Previously, the result varied by hemisphere. This affects the constructor of DateTime and other methods

DateTimeZone.convertLocalToUTC [bugs 3102760,2182444,2553453] New method now retains the offset wherever possible during calculations This affects higher methods like withHourOfDay/withMinuteOfHour/withSecondOfMinute/withMillisOfSecond which now do not change offset when called within a DST overlap

Change to test in 2002-2004 where time zone is predictable

Fix tests now that null means now in comparator
Additional tests for DateTime and Instant
Commit class so its not lost

Add extra tests for illegal sets
Adjust smaller fields after a set/add

Reorganize test classes, factoring out older ones
Add NullConverter that returns current time
Fix ObjectChronology constructor to use converter properly
Added method for supporting special parsing of two digit years.
Fixed bug parsing time zone offset where zero offset text is an empty string.
Improve support for setting partial instant values
Add validate() to Chronology for PartialInstant
Fix for bug 954058, which caused an ExceptionInInitializerError to be thrown if the system property "user.timezone" specified an explicit offset.
Explit order applied to initialization of constants.
Update resolve test and add tests for property
Remove explicit field array Rework resolve
Remove leap year code as partials cannot determine this accurately
Fix getAsText to avoid infinite recursion

Change hashcode definition to enable compatability with java.util.Date
Add support for changing the current time

Rename getDateTime method to appropriate name
Removed comments about exceptions which are no longer thrown.

Preserve time zone when converting to Calendar.
Updates to century related fields and more.

Fixed bug which caused getInstance to fail on second identical call.
Include year bounds check in getDateOnlyMillis.
Re-organized chronology package and created new field package.
Support negative weekyears; fixed minor bug in matching parser.

Fixed bug when constructing with non-ISO chronologies.
Fixed bug when weekyear changes cross cutover.
Can't use strictfp, need jre1.2 compatibility.
Extended time zone offset precision, ensuring that for Joda, all instants converted to strings can be parsed back into the exact same instant.
Time zone offset parser supports fractional seconds leading with comma.
Fewer substrings created during integer parsing, resulting in performance improvements.
More performance improvements due to less object allocation.
Reduced temporary object allocations during parse.
Bug fixes in set matching parse.
Reflect changes in property package class renames.
Make class names follow consistent naming pattern.
Fix a bug in timezone obtaining
Support parsing more fractional time elements.
In set, fix range check for fields with imprecise ranges.

Require appending formatter, not just a printer.
